dt: {bc}a numerical representation (such as ³/₄, ⁵/₈, or 3.234) indicating the quotient of two numbers
{bc}one of several portions (as of a distillate) separable by {a_link|fractionation}

et: Middle English {it}fraccioun{/it} "act or result of breaking, mathematical fraction," borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}frāctiōn-, frāctiō{/it} "breaking, division into parts, mathematical fraction," going back to Late Latin, "breaking, weariness, illness," from Latin {it}frag-,{/it} variant stem of {it}frangere{/it} "to break, shatter" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action {ma}{mat|break:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a numerical representation (such as 3/4, 5/8, or 3.234) indicating the quotient of two numbers

dt: {bc}a fraction (such as ¹/₂ or ³/₄) in which the numerator and denominator are both integers and are separated by a horizontal or slanted line {dx}compare {dxt|decimal fraction||}{/dx}

shortdef: a fraction (such as 1/2 or 3/4) in which the numerator and denominator are both integers and are separated by a horizontal or slanted line

dt: {bc}a fraction with a fraction or mixed number in the numerator or denominator or both {dx}compare {dxt|simple fraction||}{/dx}

shortdef: a fraction with a fraction or mixed number in the numerator or denominator or both

dt: {bc}a fraction whose numerator is an integer and whose denominator is an integer plus a fraction whose numerator is an integer and whose denominator is an integer plus a fraction and so on

shortdef: a fraction whose numerator is an integer and whose denominator is an integer plus a fraction whose numerator is an integer and whose denominator is an integer plus a fraction and so on

dt: {bc}a fraction (such as .25 = ²⁵/₁₀₀ or .025 = ²⁵/₁₀₀₀) or mixed number (such as 3.025 = 3²⁵/₁₀₀₀) in which the denominator is a power of 10 usually expressed by use of the decimal point

shortdef: a fraction (such as .25 = 25/100 or .025 = 25/1000) or mixed number (such as 3.025 = 325/1000) in which the denominator is a power of 10 usually expressed by use of the decimal point

dt: {bc}a fraction whose numerator is equal to, larger than, or of equal or higher degree than the denominator

shortdef: a fraction whose numerator is equal to, larger than, or of equal or higher degree than the denominator

dt: {bc}one of the simpler fractions into the sum of which the quotient of two polynomials may be decomposed

shortdef: one of the simpler fractions into the sum of which the quotient of two polynomials may be decomposed

dt: {bc}a fraction in which the numerator is less or of lower degree than the denominator

shortdef: a fraction in which the numerator is less or of lower degree than the denominator

dt: {bc}a fraction having whole numbers for the numerator and denominator {dx}compare {dxt|complex fraction||}{/dx}

shortdef: a fraction having whole numbers for the numerator and denominator
